title: Logotype
content:
Hi guys,

Just wondering if I could get some feedback on this type..

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202150228im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tunein_logo_3495.jpg)

Cheers,  
Brad

 [‹ mark critique](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202150228/http:/typophile.com/node/50823 "Go to previous forum topic") [Building a concept for "wellsense" public health consultants ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202150228/http:/typophile.com/node/49846 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tuneintokyo

comments.content: Just how it’s laid out etc - I’m not 100% classically trained when it comes to type, it looks right to me but there might be some slight kerning issues or some rule that I haven’t adhered to etc - if not, great!

Some other information about what it’s for and why you did it the way you did might spark some conversation.

penn
it’s a logo for a multimedia design company

here’s a handy trick for kerning. It’s easier to kern letters you can’t read, and youre so used to seeing not only these letters, but these words, that you often over-look the spacing even when you’re trying to.

Simple Solution: turn the type upside down. The gaps will jump out at you instantly.

Hope this trick helps if you didn’t already know it, I know it’s saved me more times than I wish to admit...

even for 1 minutes work, there’s not much to comment on.  
there’s plenty in this ... the word “in” references to tokyo, whatever connection can be drawn from the selection of the term “tune in tokyo” and so on.

—————  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design Melbourne](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202150228/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)  
 [Bicycle Film Festival](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202150228/http:/www.bicyclefilmfestival.com.au/)
